sections.purpose: To incubate samples at a constant temperature in a water medium.
sections.scope: Applicable to microbiological assays and reagent warming.
procedure: Fill the bath with distilled water up to the marked level.
Set the desired temperature on the controller and switch ON the heater.
Allow the temperature to stabilize before placing samples.
Place tubes or flasks in racks to prevent tipping.
Cover the bath with a lid to reduce evaporation.
After use, switch OFF the heater, allow water to cool, then drain and clean the bath.
precautions: Never operate the bath without water.
Use distilled water to reduce scale formation.
Avoid splashing water onto electrical components.
Do not exceed the recommended maximum temperature.
Disinfect the water regularly to prevent microbial growth.
